intro: Holosteum umbellatum var. tenerrimum, commonly known as the slender waterplantain, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to wetlands and marshy areas. It features slender, elongated leaves that are often submerged or floating, adapted to aquatic environments. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in an umbel, which is typical of the Pontederiaceae family. Its root system helps stabilize soil and improve water quality in wetland ecosystems. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in nutrient-rich waters.
